programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: The most common problem for amateur golfers is the slice. Cameron McCormick, the 2015 PGA Teacher of the Year, tackles this issue by explaining how club delivery with the face and path dictates curve.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.sub-title: The Playbook - Snake in the Grass
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick moves to the putting green to teach the best strategies to making more putts and conquering the dreaded yips. McCormick explains the importance of the start line and how to gain control of the putter face for optimal control.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.sub-title: The Playbook - Foundation and Coordination for Juniors
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick, the 2015 PGA Teacher of the Year, unlocks the secrets to building a championship-caliber golf game.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick teaches the what and how behind the score-saving shots that amaze people who watch professional golf. Specialty shots take center stage as viewers learn how to execute the "Skid Spinner," "Super Flop," and the "Banker."

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick demonstrates how to execute difficult fairway bunker shots, dreaded mid-range bunker shots, and buried bunker lies.

programme.title: Build A Better Game
programme.desc: Golf has never been more of a power game than it is right now. Shortening the golf course off the tee has a bigger impact on lowering scores than ever before. And it's not just a strategy for disruptor-pros like Bryson DeChambeau.

programme.title: School of Golf

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin gives a lesson on the role of the lead wrist in the golf swing; 3 tips to improve your short game; a ball striking secret from 3-time Senior Open champion Bernhard Langer; how your shadow can be used as a swing aid.

programme.title: School of Golf
